title: Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan
summary: Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan (Arabic: ٱلشَّيْخ زَايِد بِن سُلْطَان آل نَهْيَان‎, romanized: Ash-Shaykh Zāyed bin Sulṭān Āl Nahyān; 6 May 1918 – 2 November 2004) was the founding father[2][3][4][5] and the principal driving force behind the formation of the United Arab Emirates, uniting seven emirates, and becoming the Union's first Raʾīs (president), a post which he held for a period of almost 33 years (1971 until his death in 2004).[1][6] He was also the ruler of Abu Dhabi for more than 30 years (6 August 1966[7] – 2 November 2004). He is commonly referred to in the UAE as the Father of the Nation.[8]
